name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Taking the COVID-19 vaccine is a personal choice.   I’ve signed SB 658, to ensure that students can go to school without that choice being made for them.  This bill also prevents schools from requiring vaccine passports or masks for unvaccinated students.  https://t.co/x14btU3bW9

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: I am withdrawing Oklahoma's COVID-19 State of Emergency effective tomorrow, May 4.   Our 7-day average of new cases is down 94%, and we have some of the lowest cases per capita in the country.  Hospitalizations are down 90% and stable.   Oklahoma, it's time to return to normal.  https://t.co/fBubqAGzc0

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: In the next few days, we're on track to reach 2 million doses of the COVID-19 vaccine administered in Oklahoma.  That's incredible!  Deputy Commissioner Keith Reed, the team at @HealthyOklahoma, and our tribal/federal partners are doing an incredible job. Keep up the good work!  https://t.co/mByfLxIAgl

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Today I received the COVID-19 vaccine.   It's available to all Oklahomans 16 and up, and I encourage you to get one too.  Thank you Marcia Castellanos-Aymat with @HealthyOklahoma for making the shot quick and painless!  https://t.co/s4O31RzZr9

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: ONE MILLION PEOPLE VACCINATED!  The CDC says one million Oklahomans have received at least one dose of the COVID vaccine. Over 500,000 are fully vaccinated!  @HealthyOklahoma and our federal/tribal partners continue to do an amazing job. Keep it up!   https://t.co/2iRwKSqZT9

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: I had a great time on @foxandfriends this morning talking about how the standard for normal in Oklahoma is freedom and how we made teachers a priority for the COVID-19 vaccine.  We can -- and will -- get our summer back!  https://t.co/SZ6LuTFIZ4

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: I want to thank Jimmy Mitchell and @SLRSinc for helping us keep Oklahomans informed during our live COVID-19 updates.   What you don't get to see on TV is his partner who is listening to what we say and signing it to Jimmy so he can share it with everyone. It's a team effort!  https://t.co/Z5PwfgcjqF

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: I've said from the beginning, the goal is not zero cases. COVID-19 will never disappear completely.  That doesn't mean we can't get our summer back.  https://t.co/yqTRDXAmUz

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: COVID-19 has affected our entire nation. Here in Oklahoma, we took the right approach.  https://t.co/qf9T7ouzXD

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: One year ago, former Secretaries Dr. Kayse Shrum & Jerome Loughridge were leading the charge in our COVID fight.  Their guidance at the onset of the pandemic in OK was crucial. They helped us increase our testing, secure PPE, and so much more.   Thank you for your service!  https://t.co/3IQCEbH7Lw

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Starting today, teachers and Oklahomans under 65 with comorbidities can receive the COVID-19 vaccine.  Thank you @HealthyOklahoma for all of your hard work that made this possible!

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: In response to the severe weather, @HealthyOklahoma says it's planning to add COVID vaccine clinics that will focus on our 65+ group, especially those needing their 2nd shot.  I'm also told supply should NOT be effected.  We expect to receive 137,000 doses next week.

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: 400,000 VACCINATIONS!  Thanks to the hard work by @HealthyOklahoma, over 400,000 Oklahomans have received their first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine.  That's more than the total number of cases we've had in our state.  We will continue to lead the nation in vaccinations.  https://t.co/lbPlR10fCx

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Dr. Brooks was very helpful as we launched the state-of-the-art Oklahoma Pandemic Center for Innovation & Excellence and helped us get our own EUA for in-home saliva-based COVID testing.   He was a pioneer in molecular medicine testing and will be missed.   https://t.co/ZuLaZroajk

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Our COVID-19 cases continue to go down and we will soon have more Oklahomans with the vaccine than who have had the virus.  That wouldn't be possible without the hard work and dedication from our health care workers across the state.  We will forever owe them a debt of gratitude.  https://t.co/eXBfGu65SS

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: 1,130 Oklahomans are receiving their COVID-19 vaccine today at Ebenezer Baptist Church.  Thank you Pastor @DerrickScobey, @HealthyOklahoma, @okchealth, @davidfholt and @integrishealth for working together to make this happen!  https://t.co/2sRvkr0EC6

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: New COVID-19 cases in Oklahoma were down 36% last week across the state and hospitalizations are declining as well.  This is positive news, but now isn't the time to relax. Keep doing your part by wearing a mask, washing your hands, and watching your distance.

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: It was my honor to take part in the ribbon cutting ceremony for the new Oklahoma Pandemic Center for Innovation and Excellence.  I was also able to tour the newly renovated Public Health Lab. These updates will go a long way in helping fight COVID-19 and future health crises.

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Great news from @HealthyOklahoma that COVID-19 cases and hospitalizations are trending down across the state.  We still need all Oklahomans to continue to do their part. Wear a mask, watch your distance, and wash your hands.

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: I applaud the work @jessgarvin85 is doing with the Stephens County Health Department and @HealthyOklahoma to get the COVID-19 vaccine to our most vulnerable.  Things like this are exactly why Oklahoma is a Top Ten State for vaccine distribution!   https://t.co/RkQWCKpcFW

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: According to the CDC, we are currently 7th in the nation in COVID vaccines administered per capita.  This wouldn't be possible without the hard work by Deputy Commissioner Keith Reed, his team at @HealthyOklahoma and partners across the state.  Great job!   https://t.co/2iRwKSqZT9

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: More than 100,000 COVID-19 vaccines have now been given to Oklahomans across the state.  @HealthyOklahoma will continue to work to get vaccines to Oklahomans quickly and effectively as we receive more doses from the federal government.

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: The team at @HealthyOklahoma is doing a great job trying to make sure every Oklahoman has access to the COVID-19 vaccine when it's their turn.  Visit  https://t.co/sUy7lL70aj to find out if you're eligible for a vaccine and schedule your appointment today.

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: In the first week, @HealthyOklahoma and health partners across the state have administered COVID-19 vaccines to 21,000 frontline healthcare workers and first responders who live in all 77 counties.   Many Oklahomans are working long hours behind the scenes to make this happen!

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: COVID-19 vaccinations are underway at long term care facilities in Oklahoma!  Frances Watland was the first resident to receive the vaccine at The Lodge at Brookline in Oklahoma City and Pam Byers, RN, was the first staff member.  https://t.co/oNcIBODsXs

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: ICYMI: @tulsaworld editorial: Gov. Kevin Stitt got it right when he gave teachers higher priority for COVID-19 vaccination.   https://t.co/XyVowqmT0T

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: VACCINE UPDATE: In the first five days, Oklahomans in each of our state’s 77 counties received the COVID vaccine.   The Moderna vaccine started arriving today and will let us send strike teams across the state -- including to nursing homes to vaccinate residents and staff!

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: ICYMI: @tulsaworld editorial: Gov. Kevin Stitt got it right when he gave teachers higher priority for COVID-19 vaccination.   https://t.co/XyVowqmT0T

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: BREAKING: Moderna’s COVID vaccine was just approved for emergency use in the U.S.   We'll build on this week's work with @HealthyOklahoma and all of our health partners to keep distributing these vaccines across the state.  Let's keep fighting COVID together, Oklahoma!

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Our business and community leaders in Oklahoma continue to persevere and innovate, despite the challenges the COVID-19 pandemic has brought this year. It was great to talk with some of our Tulsa business owners at the @TulsaChamber and listen to their stories.  https://t.co/9dw9gHj5nV

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: The @CDCDirector confirms school is one of the safest places kids can be.  Every Oklahoma student deserves the opportunity to be back in their classrooms with their teachers.  That's why I'm moving teachers up on the priority list for the COVID vaccine.   https://t.co/z9YTXldEks  https://t.co/LP7fzXNBrG

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: I’m continuing to fight for our teachers and students because I believe in-person school is so important for our kids.   To help with that, we’re moving K-12 teachers and support staff up to Phase 2 of our COVID-19 vaccination plan.  https://t.co/5rX9qqTcdx

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Join us live today at 12 PM as we announce the increased prioritization for Oklahoma teachers to receive the COVID-19 vaccine.  Watch here:  https://t.co/j648NqGqgh  https://t.co/N2URvB8bS9

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: The first COVID-19 vaccine administered in Southwest Oklahoma went to Laura Thomas, RN, at 3:06 p.m.   She’s served on the frontlines in the ICU since the beginning of the pandemic.   I hope Laura and all of our healthcare heroes know how grateful we are for them.  https://t.co/mgI5szERlA

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: This has been a historic week for Oklahoma & our nation in our fight against COVID-19. On Monday, we officially received the first delivery of the Pfizer vaccine & less than 72 hrs after it was cleared by the FDA, vaccines were being delivered in Oklahoma.  https://t.co/hUpvLqPxPu

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: As Oklahomans patiently wait for the vaccine, I continue to ask you to support your fellow neighbors by wearing a mask, washing your hands and watching your distance.   For more info on the distribution of the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine, click here:  https://t.co/9bWsH176U2

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: The arrival of the vaccine signifies the beginning of us turning the corner against COVID. I am committed to keeping our businesses open safely and safely getting our kids back in school.

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Less than 72 hours after it was cleared by the FDA, the COVID-19 vaccine is here in Oklahoma. Watch as we prepare to administer the first vaccine to frontline health care workers here:  https://t.co/1wbuRE5LRe

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Additionally, I’m pleased to report COVID-19 vaccines are on their way to Oklahoma. The 166,000 doses we expect in the next 3 weeks will let us make great progress with our healthcare workers and highest risk groups.   It’s not the end of our challenges, but the end is coming.

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Today I announced further steps we’re taking to implement statewide COVID-19 mitigation measures. This will bring us closer to our three goals:  - Protecting the health and lives of Oklahomans - Keep businesses open safely - Get our kids safely back in school  https://t.co/HdowforaFS

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Oklahomans have come together in an incredible way over the past 30 days to slow the spread of COVID-19. Across the state, more people than ever are following the three W’s and we need to keep it up.

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: We will be live with a COVID-19 update at 3:45 p.m. today.   Watch here:  https://t.co/vdVXlO924x

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Don’t forget the best way to stay healthy this holiday season is to follow the Three W’s. As cases of COVID-19 have risen throughout the state, we need everyone to double down on taking personal responsibility to help protect those around them.  https://t.co/XYfhCwFIuX

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Today, I remember a remarkable man who lost his life to COVID-19. Bill Gumerson was one of Oklahoma City's most significant preservationists and co-founded Friends of the Mansion.   His work to preserve our community’s history will not soon be forgotten.   https://t.co/1EvOzmxxYT

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Starting Saturday, we’re adding more free COVID test sites in parts of Western Oklahoma through a partnership with @HHSGov and @HealthyOklahoma.  Pre-registration is open now.  Tests will be nasal self-swabs & less invasive than some forms of testing.   https://t.co/n3wV07ZkWx

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: I had a great meeting with @VP yesterday!   We talked about COVID-19 vaccines that are on the way and our plan to distribute them to health care workers, teachers and the most vulnerable ASAP. (1/2)  https://t.co/Tp3QpuszHr

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Cases of COVID are rising across the nation & Oklahoma is no different. We need to slow the spread of this virus.  Today, I announced some actions we’re taking to continue to protect the health and lives of Oklahomans against COVID-19.

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Join us live today at 12 PM for an update on the State's response to COVID-19.   Join our Livestream here🔻  https://t.co/dLdgyapNUw

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: We’re all in this together.  Oklahoma, please take a minute to listen to Dr. Julie Watson from @integrishealth on why we need to all keep doing our part to fight COVID-19.  https://t.co/LegnzTF0cW

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Oklahoma, we can’t get complacent against COVID-19. We need to keep our foot on the gas and for everyone to do their part to prevent the spread of this disease. Remember: ✅Watch your distance ✅Wash your hands ✅Wear a mask in public  https://t.co/6KW3hmr9hL

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: We’re also recommending all college students to get a COVID test before they leave campus for Thanksgiving break. Both @UofOklahoma and @okstate have committed to providing free testing for students and this will ensure students don’t bring the virus back with them.

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Today we gave an update on how our State is continuing to respond to COVID-19. We are working closely with our medical community to fight this virus.  Our goal is to keep Oklahomans safe and healthy and I know Oklahomans will work together with us to ensure this.

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Join us live at 2 PM today for an update on State’s response to COVID-19 at OU Health Sciences Center. View our Livestream here 🔽  https://t.co/NENHvAas7U  https://t.co/UE5xxXlmh1

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Grateful to see @RoseState’s new drone tech is helping keep students and the community on campus safe. I'm happy to see collaborative innovation like this taking place across our state as we continue to protect Oklahomans and mitigate the spread of COVID-19. #OklaProud

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Top Ten Alert!   Oklahoma now has the 9th-lowest unemployment rate in the nation at 5.3%. As we continue to recover from the impact of COVID-19, I remain committed to getting our people safely back to work and strengthening our state's vibrant economy.  https://t.co/UDh0cyt909

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Join us live on YouTube at 3:30 PM for an update on the State’s hospital capacity, surge plan, and response to COVID-19 🔽  https://t.co/2TA3mWjbrl  https://t.co/PMvW0oCCxt

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Honored to hear the story of COVID-19 survivor Tami Torres this morning & how @RepJasonLowe's convalescent plasma donation helped provide her a life-saving treatment. I encourage those who've recovered from the virus to continue to donate & help their fellow Oklahomans in need.  https://t.co/6Of30dsNOa

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: These leaders have provided strong visions & steady leadership for our state & the people they serve amidst the COVID-19 pandemic.   I'm proud to appoint them & look forward to how they will continue to move the needle in the health & care of Oklahomans.  https://t.co/cst51phLrb

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: It was an honor to welcome @DepSecHargan & @ACFHHS Assistant Sec. Johnson to our new Community HOPE Centers today. These centers are one way Oklahoma is leading the nation in bridging the education gaps caused by COVID-19.  https://t.co/5aVmFake5J

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Sarah and I join with the millions of Oklahomans and Americans who are praying for the quick and full recovery of @realDonaldTrump, @FLOTUS and everyone else battling COVID-19.

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Oklahoma has received an initial allocation of roughly 77,000 Abbott Laboratories BinaxNOW rapid point-of-care COVID-19 tests from the federal government.  Watch the video below for the full update!  https://t.co/4BdxMOwHfj

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: I enjoyed looking back at some of these photos from before COVID when I was able to visit our state agencies to meet my fellow coworkers.   Everything looks a little different now, but I am still thankful for the work they do each day to move Oklahoma forward.  https://t.co/RcGFpARfUK

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: On a 7-day average, 9.1% of Oklahoma’s COVID-19 tests are positive. That is 15th in the country, but lower than neighboring states like KS, TX, AR and MO.  Let’s keep fighting to continue lowering our numbers.  Testing is still free at 80 sites across OK. Call 211 for more.  https://t.co/ABwObdEWRM

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: We are live providing an update on the State's response to COVID-19.   Tune in on our Youtube page 🔻  https://t.co/EzrbkKb4uW

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: It’s a great day for @CowboyFB in Stillwater!  I’ll be on with @gopokesvoice at halftime to thank @okstate for everything the university has done to help our state fight COVID-19.  96.1 in OKC, 1170 in Tulsa or 93.7 in Stillwater!   Full affiliate list:  https://t.co/k0qcgP8fmZ  https://t.co/SIunYe4nGW

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: If you have recovered from COVID-19, your plasma donation could save the lives of 4 of your fellow Oklahomans.   Contact @okblood to make an appointment today!  Don't forget, regular blood donations are in high demand as well.   https://t.co/psKhEGpjvI.  https://t.co/APHyPiwHNP

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: 65% of the counties in Oklahoma are in low risk or new normal phases. Oklahomans are fighting back against COVID-19 and it shows!   Continue to follow our Public Health Advisory to help us stop the spread.    https://t.co/iAl5n5iKPY  https://t.co/509eKB3hiU

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: I'm calling on all Oklahomans who have recovered from COVID-19 to join me in donating convalescent plasma to help us fight this virus.   One donation @okblood can save up to four lives! The need for plasma is up 700% and donating is easy.   Read more:  https://t.co/kJmVEJgLwm  https://t.co/4Ojs8f60q7

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: We are live providing an update on the State's COVID-19 Hospital Surge Plan.  Livestream ⤵️  https://t.co/MdDe1fwrpV

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Join us today at 11:00 AM for an update on the State's COVID-19 Hospital Surge Plan.  Tune in🔽  https://t.co/XXk8pmC9UH  https://t.co/ecmyGPcYAL

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: As we continue to fight #COVID19, we want all Oklahomans to have transparent access to community data so they can make informed decisions to protect the health & lives of their loved ones.  That's why introduced the new COVID-19 Alert System.  https://t.co/o99z5IMjkC

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: The State of Oklahoma is thankful for our hard working @OKGuard members. Whether it be responding to storms and floods, helping fight COVID-19 or providing support to keep Oklahomans safe, the @OKGuard is always ready, always there. #OklaProud  https://t.co/zc9UpYGa1o

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: With the 2nd fewest COVID-19 cases per capita in states with more than 2 million residents, Oklahoma is leading the way in safely and responsibly reopening our state.  Out of more than 150 clubs nationwide, @LifeTime_Life chose Oklahoma City as its first location to reopen.  https://t.co/ExSibDHx2a

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Our comprehensive hospital plan is working and we currently have more than enough hospital beds, ICU beds, & ventilators statewide but, we remain prepared for a surge.  @integrishealth has stepped up as a COVID Flex location in OKC as part of our Hospital Surge Plan.

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Thank you to @UPT and all of our truck drivers across the state who are stepping up to deliver PPE supplies to Oklahomans who need it most during COVID-19. I'm proud of your innovation, hard work and resilience to #FlattenTheCurve. #OklaProud    https://t.co/jKHD9dKOUc

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: I am happy to announce @POTUS has approved our request for a Major Disaster Declaration that covers all 77 Oklahoma counties.  This will allow more federal assistance to come our way as we continue to battle COVID-19.  https://t.co/rPWKIP2KRF

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: Our health care workers are the true heroes in this fight against COVID-19. These protections will help us #FlattenTheCurve and continue to keep our health care workers and their families safe as they take care of their fellow Oklahomans.   Read the EO ➡️  https://t.co/tcWcuHOXTj

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: I amended Executive Order 2020-07 tonight to allow @okstate and @UofOklahoma labs to perform COVID-19 testing. We are still determining their exact testing capacity, but I'm excited about how our state’s research universities are working to find innovative solutions. (1/2)  https://t.co/In2mcnd3kM

name: Governor Kevin Stitt
tweet: In order to provide our hard working public health officials, health care providers, state agencies & small businesses the ability to unlock additional resources as we respond to COVID-19, we have issued an emergency declaration for the State of Oklahoma:  https://t.co/iXfGbZeni8  https://t.co/UCYSbar7PN
